ShortDescription: Southern Glazer’s Wine and Spirits is seeking candidates for aLeadBusiness Analyst – WA Sales Commissions & Incentives Processopportunity in the Washington Area…
FullDescription:
Description

Southern Glazer’s Wine and Spirits is seeking candidates for aLeadBusiness Analyst – WA Sales Commissions & Incentives Processopportunity in the Washington Area, based in Bellevue, Washington.Duties include but are not limited to the following:

  • Point of contact for SGWS supplier incentives for management, employees, and suppliers.
  • Process SGWS Supplier Incentives & SGWS Sales Commissions on a monthly basis.
  • Regularly update and maintain the incentive earnings on company SharePoint.
  • Provides technical assistance by responding to inquiries from management & employees regarding errors, problems, or questions about reports, programs, or incentives.
  • Accurately maintains databases related to both Commissions & Incentives
  • Generates reports as requested or required by management or suppliers.
  • Extensive use of various business intelligence platforms; including but not limited to ProDiver, IBM National Sales Manager (NSM), AS400 (Unix), SAP BusinessObjects.
  • Confers with persons originating, handling, processing, or receiving incentive payments and provides recommendations as needed.
  • Confers with management to analyze current operational procedures, identify problems, understand how data is to be summarized, and reports are to be formatted.
  • Provides training on Diver, Business Objects, AS400, NSM, and other SGWS systems.
  • Oversees scorecard programs to ensure that information is tracked, compiled, and reported for payment on a timely basis.
  • Maintain business composure under weight of deadlines and multiple project workloads.


Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications:
  • Excellent analytical & presentation skills
  • Extensive experience using Microsoft Excel (Formulas, Pivot Tables, VBA/Macros) & other MS Office Products (Access, Outlook, Powerpoint)
  • At least one year experience of project management with proven track record.
  • Ability to learn and adapt to new software/systems quickly.
  • Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, and customers.
  • Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form.
  • Ability to independently complete projects on time, producing work that is thorough, accurate, and compelling.
  • Ability to work collaboratively with team members and management.
  • Ability to lead team to successful outcomes.
  • Willingness to grow and increase aptitude.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s Degree preferred
  • Proficiency in Data Science – Creating/Managing Data Framework for Storage & Reporting
  • Ability to write SQL Queries to access Data Tables using MS SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS)
  • Proven experience in gathering business/reporting requirements for vital stakeholders in building processes & technical solutions


Job:Administrative
Primary Location:United States-Washington-Bellevue
Shift:Day Shift

ShortDescription: Gallagher is a global leader in insurance, risk management and consulting services. We help businesses grow, communities thrive and people prosper.
FullDescription:
Gallagher is a global leader in insurance, risk management and consulting services. We help businesses grow, communities thrive and people prosper. We live a culture defined by The Gallagher Way, our set of shared values and guiding tenets. A culture driven by our people, over 30,000 strong, serving our clients with customized solutions that will protect them and fuel their futures.

Gallagher Benefit Services, Inc. (GBS) consistently stands out in a competitive marketplace as an employer of knowledgeable, highly skilled and competitive talent. We are a company that touches businesses and their employees on a personal level. At the core, our job is to help protect the health and well-being of employees and their families and provide for their financial security – all while allowing employers to attract and retain the people they need to grow and succeed. As you consider the value of working for Gallagher Benefit Services, remember your talent, winning attitude and strong performance will be highly valued and will maximize your future potential.
Position Summary:

Internally focused, contributes to the creation and development of carrier market programs concentrated on market relations, creation of panels for product support, qualifying insurance carriers, and establishing commission terms and conditions.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
  • Managing, monitoring, and negotiating renewal of existing carrier agreements.
  • Acting as an advocate for existing client carriers, and reviewing carrier commission schedules and seeking most favorable plans for division branch network.
  • Working closely with regional/branch network in regard to locally administered plans and helping to navigate national plans.
  • Working with business niches in developing enhanced compensation plans with key markets.
  • Measuring and reporting on the various forms of compensation paid to AJG by insurance carriers.
Additional considerations may also include:
  • Working closely with our carrier contacts to develop new and enhance existing compensation plans.
  • Reviewing compensation plans of recent acquisitions to work toward integrating into existing AJG/Division plans.
  • Supporting contracted client in using and accessing the carrier platform.
  • Works with a large degree of autonomy under the instruction of more senior staff.
  • Will support on key projects and may lead smaller projects.
Required:
  • Bachelor's degree
  • 2 or more years related experience.
U.S. Eligibility Requirements:
  • Interested candidates must submit an application and resume/CV online to be considered.
  • Must be 18 years of age or older.
  • Must be willing to submit to a background investigation; any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background investigation.
  • Must have unrestricted work authorization to work in the United States. For U.S. employment opportunities, Gallagher hires U.S. citizens, permanent residents, asylees, refugees, and temporary residents. Temporary residence does not include those with non-immigrant work authorization (F, J, H or L visas), such as students in practical training status. Exceptions to these requirements will be determined based on shortage of qualified candidates with a particular skill. Gallagher will require proof of work authorization.
  • Must be willing to execute Gallagher's Employee Agreement or Confidentiality and Non-Disclosure Agreement, which require, among other things, post-employment obligations relating to non-solicitation, confidentiality and non-disclosure.
Gallagher offers competitive salaries and benefits, including: medical/dental/vision plans, life and accident insurance, 401(K), employee stock purchase plan, educational expense reimbursement, employee assistance program, flexible work hours (availability varies by office and job function) training programs, matching gift program, and more.

Gallagher believes that all persons are entitled to equal employment opportunity and does not discriminate against nor favor any applicant because of race, sex, color, disability, national origin, religion, creed, age, marital status, citizenship, veteran status, gender, gender identity / expression, actual or perceived sexual orientation, or any other protected characteristic. Equal employment opportunity will be extended in all aspects of the employer-employee relationship, including, but not limited to, recruitment, hiring, training, promotion, transfer, demotion, compensation, benefits, layoff, and termination. In addition, Gallagher will make reasonable accommodations to known physical or mental limitations of an otherwise qualified applicant with a disability, unless the accommodation would impose an undue hardship on the operation of our business.

  • Managing, monitoring, and negotiating renewal of existing carrier agreements.
  • Acting as an advocate for existing client carriers, and reviewing carrier commission schedules and seeking most favorable plans for division branch network.
  • Working closely with regional/branch network in regard to locally administered plans and helping to navigate national plans.
  • Working with business niches in developing enhanced compensation plans with key markets.
  • Measuring and reporting on the various forms of compensation paid to AJG by insurance carriers.
']

RoleTitle: Key Holder, Robert Graham - Bellevue Square, WA
ShortDescription: ROBERT GRAHAM founded in 2001, is an American eclectic luxury men's and women's apparel brand. We sell to top US retailers including Neiman Marcus, Saks along…
FullDescription:
Specific Responsibilities

ROBERT GRAHAM founded in 2001, is an American eclectic luxury men's and women's apparel brand. We sell to top US retailers including Neiman Marcus, Saks along with the very best specialties retailers, as well as key doors internationally.

ABOUT THE JOB:
Position is responsible to support overall sales in the store, staff, merchandise and customer service, while promoting a sales culture to build productivity and passion for the brand. This position will ensure that all internal and external customers receive exemplary service and receive a positive store/brand experience.

SALES GENERATION:
  • Meet sales goals-Continuously motivate sales staff to meet assigned sales and productivity goals
  • Support the development of associates' sales techniques, ensuring utilization of elevated levels of sales and service to maximize sales
  • Demonstrate an in-depth knowledge of the merchandise; ensure selling is fluent in all aspects of product knowledge with an ability to grow within the company
  • Demonstrate sales leadership for staff by playing an active role on the selling floor-collaborate with the management to identify marketing opportunities to support sales;
  • Work with the Store Manager to develop events/incentives that will continue to grow customer base, with particular emphasis on building local market.
CUSTOMER SERVICE:

Ensure all associates provide the highest level of customer service to achieve World Class Service standards
  • Ensure staff maintains constant client communication through referring to client books and client database
  • Resolve all client problems and complaints quickly and effectively
  • Assist sales associates with various customer service issues i.e. dissatisfied customers, returns, defective merchandise.
  • Empower associates to make decisions in the customer's best interest that also support the Company's philosophy

Skills and Requirements

  • Is dedicated to meeting the expectations and requirements of internal and external customers.
  • Gets first-hand customer information and uses it for improvements in products and services.
  • Acts with customers in mind; establishes and maintains effective relationships with customers
  • Be knowledgeable and enthusiastic about fashion
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Availability to work weekends and Holidays and report to work on a timely fashion
  • Ability to support management with supervision of scheduled staff in the store
  • Hold Store Key
WE OFFER:
  • Excellent career growth opportunities,
  • Hourly Rate plus commission;
  • Dynamic teamwork environment;

Robert Graham is an equal opportunity employer

Indeed-C
#LI-POST

ShortDescription: I am in college in an Introduction to Web Systems and Media.I have a few days left to do 2 assignments and then 1 week to do the last 2 assignments.
FullDescription:
I am in college in an Introduction to Web Systems and Media. I have a few days left to do 2 assignments and then 1 week to do the last 2 assignments.

Student/Parent Information:
Location: Kennewick, WA 99336
Subject: web development and Media

Lesson Information:
Availability: I'm flexible
Preferred lesson location: Online

Web Design Tutoring & Teaching opportunities available in Kennewick, WA starting at $25-$50/hr.

  • Apply to become a tutor listed on Wyzant to help this student and other students in your community
  • Work with a variety of students in your best subjects
  • Spend more time teaching and less time administering
  • Set your own hours while you help students learn the subjects you love to teach
Qualifications
  • A love of learning
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Expertise in a variety of disciplines
  • Passion for helping others learn and succeed
Pay
  • Set your own rate (most tutors charge between $30-60/hour)
  • Commission fee is only 20-40% compared to the 60-80% that traditional tutoring companies take.
Application Process
  • Upon submission, your application will be reviewed to ensure quality before becoming active.
  • You'll receive an initial response within 48 hours of submission.

Company: SuperFloors, subsidiary of Interior Logic Group
ShortDescription: The Designer is responsible for working with homeowners and builders to plan, design, and notate finish selections. Support Interior Logic Group initiatives.
FullDescription:
Base salary + commission.

JOB SUMMARY: The Designer is responsible for working with homeowners and builders to plan, design, and notate finish selections.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:

  • Welcome, greet, and converse with homeowners while selecting interior selections/options. Builders may have additional products that the Design Consultant must be knowledgeable about and will also review with homeowners.
  • Schedule homeowners/builders for design appts using Outlook (does not apply if DC has design coordinator.)
  • Sketch drawings for tile, stone designs, and elevations.
  • Turn in all homeowner payments, paperwork, and drawings within required timeline.
  • Complete specified home packages as requested by sales person and or project manager.
  • Design and create presentation or color boards as needed.
  • Maintain good communication with the sales team on all projects.
  • Complete and pass all modules of the DCS training and HDS training.
  • Attend all designer meetings as set by the Design Center Manager and other management requested meetings.
  • Contribute to the growth of the design department by participating in design center functions. Such as, giving presentations as requested by the Design Center Manager at group meetings.
  • General correspondence with clients including phone and email returned within the same business day.
  • Visit model homes and or job sites as needed and note on calendar.
  • Maintain a clean and orderly showroom environment; all samples should be put away following each appointment and at end of day.
  • Communicate any updates of showroom product inventory to design center manager.
  • Daily showroom walk through insuring lights, sound and operational equipment are in working order; any needs should be submitted to corresponding department.
  • Discontinued and dropped products will need to be pulled and disposed of appropriately following notification from the Merchandising Department or Design Center Manager.
  • Communication with Design Center Manager about showroom products and sample needs.
  • Responsible for communicating and assisting Merchandising Department/Design Center Manager regarding pricing and labeling needs.
  • Track homeowner/builder appts in design tracking log via SharePoint.
  • Communicate and track all appointments from Homeowner Care or Claims Department and turn in re-selection paper work to the Homeowner Care or Claims Department for payment.
  • Interfacing with vendor representatives and sales force to coordinate product knowledge meetings.
  • Support Interior Logic Group initiatives.
  • Sitting, typing, stooping, reaching, seeing, hearing, speaking, bending, lifting showroom samples.
  • Standing for long periods of time during buyer selections.

OTHER:

  • Contribute to a positive and productive work environment.
  • Conform with and abide by all regulations, policies, work procedures, and instructions.
  • Conform with all safety rules and use all appropriate safety equipment.

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • High School Diploma or GED; or one-year related experience and/or training or equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Design/sales experience, preferably in builder market.
  • Sketching & drawing skills.
  • Strong computer skills – must know Microsoft Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint.
  • Communicate effectively with customers, co-workers, and supervisors in a professional and courteous manner.
  • Must be punctual and professional.
  • Strong organization and time management required.

Physical Demands

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit, talk, hear and see. The employee frequently is required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to stand and walk. The employee will regularly be reaching, pulling and lifting up to 15 pounds at or above shoulder height, as well as repeated lifting and or movement of up to 25 pounds.

Job Types: Full-time, Commission

Salary: $35,000.00 to $36,000.00 /year

Experience:

  • Interior Design: 1 year (Preferred)
  • Sales: 1 year (Preferred)

Location:

  • Lacey, WA (Required)

Commission Only:

  • No

Additional Compensation:

  • Commission

Work Location:

  • One location

Benefits:

  • Health insurance
  • Dental insurance
  • Vision insurance
  • Retirement plan
  • Paid time off

Pay Frequency:

  • Bi weekly or Twice monthly

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

  • High School Diploma or GED; or one-year related experience and/or training or equivalent combination of education and experience.
']

Company: State of Washington Utilities and Transportation C...
ShortDescription: Help protect the consumers of Washington state! The Washington Utilities and Transportation Commission (UTC) is seeking qualified candidates for two positions…
FullDescription:
Description

Respect. Professionalism. Integrity. Accountability.

Help protect the consumers of Washington state!
The Washington Utilities and Transportation Commission (UTC) is seeking qualified candidates for two positions that will perform economic and financial analysis as part of our Regulatory Services Division. We may also consider candidates for an in-training appointment to these positions as a Regulatory Analyst 1. The salary for the in-training level is $4,066 to $5,334 per month. Upon successful completion of the training program, the incumbents will advance to the Regulatory Analyst 2 level.

One of the positions is part of the of Energy Regulation section, which provides broad regulatory oversight of electric and gas utilities and leads the agency's analytical review of utility cost of service and requests to increase rates. This position will be a member of a sub-team within the Energy Regulation section that considers how regulation can adapt to the evolving energy landscape, and performs economic analysis on issues such as distribution system investments, reliability and resiliency improvements, smart grid technologies, critical infrastructure, distributed energy resource pricing, and grid modernization.

The other position is part of the Conservation and Energy Planning (CEP) section, which is focused on ensuring that conservation and renewable energy requirements as embodied in the Washington Energy Independence Act (RCW 19.285) are met. Additionally, the section leads the agency's review of integrated resource plans, and reviews various issues in rate cases and tariff filings. CEP also engages in workshops and rulemakings on the appropriate regulatory status of unique issues such as low income support policies and new services like roof top solar devices.

About the UTC and Employer Initiatives
The UTC regulates the rates, services and practices of private or investor-owned utilities and transportation companies.

The UTC is continually recognized for its excellence and integrity as a utility and transportation regulatory agency, as we challenge the status quo and ourselves.

At the UTC, we recognize that our employees are the key to the agency's success. We are committed to our work, but value the balance with our personal lives. We demonstrate our commitment to employees by providing an environment that stimulates professional growth, continued learning opportunities, offers meaningful work and a comprehensive benefits package. For more information about benefits, please visit http://www.utc.wa.gov/aboutUs/careers/Pages/Working-at-UTC.aspx.

The UTC is a great place to work and has implemented several, and is developing additional, initiatives that create a great working environment, including:
  • We have modernized our workplace with workspaces that promote creative thought, innovation, and collaboration among co-workers, and improved building security and employee safety.
  • We support a healthy work/life balance by offering flexible/alternative work schedules and mobile and telework options. (Depending on job duties).
  • We have a formal mentoring program to provide and encourage employee growth and development, while also promoting informal mentoring relationships and sharing of knowledge across the commission.
  • We have an Infant at Work Program that is based on the long-term values of breastfeeding newborns and infant-parent bonding. Eligible employees who are new mothers, fathers, or legal guardians can bring their infant (six weeks to six months, and in limited circumstances, up to nine months) when returning to work. (Depending on job duties and work location).
  • We have an engaging wellness program which focuses on all nine elements of wellness: spiritual, physical, social, environmental, occupational, emotional, intellectual, nutritional, and financial. The UTC has received the state's Zo8 award the past five years for our achievements in building a sustainable wellness program.
  • We have a comprehensive continuous improvement program focused on using Lean tools and principles to solve problems and continuously improve work processes.
  • We use a structured, data-driven Lean Management System methodology to manage the core work and key initiatives of the commission and provide employees with a clear line of site from their daily work to the agency level key goals, outcomes, and core processes.
  • We value and are actively involved in promoting diversity and inclusion within the UTC by way of a cross-divisional, collaborative committee. The focus of the committee includes employee engagement and education; reinforcing UTC values; and maximizing the value of diversity and identifying strategies for inclusion.

For more information about the UTC, see our website www.utc.wa.gov – or visit www.twitter.com/wautc and www.facebook.com/wautc.

What you will be doing:

Energy Regulation position primary duties include:
  • Reviews, analyzes and reaches conclusions on complex utility filings.
  • Evaluates the validity of utility requests through quantitative analysis and by applying principles of economics, financial accounting, and regulatory theory.
  • Provides the Commission with objective recommendations on decisions for utility filings through formal written memoranda, commissioner briefings, and public presentation.
  • Provides the Commission with objective recommendations on complex issues in a formal adjudications, such as general rate proceedings, through written expert testimony. Defends staff positions against cross examination by opposing counsel. Participates as a member of a team critically and comprehensively assessing the utility's need for additional revenues.
  • Participates in individual and team projects exploring defined investigative, administrative or policy issues, often initiated by the Commission or its regulatory staff rather than by a utility filing. Duties may include consideration of new or revised approaches to utility regulation and initiatives to improve the efficiency of Energy Regulation's business processes.

CEP position primary duties include:
  • Conducts economic evaluations of utility company filings regarding: conservation goals that conform with Washington statutes; the attainment of previously determined conservation targets; the prudence of investments in generation and distribution facilities; the portfolio of energy resources to meet future service needs; complex pricing proposals designed to promote conservation; the introduction of new services; and plans to support low income customers.
  • Uses economic analysis to create recommendations to senior management and commissioners. Develops written testimony that is filed in highly contentious legal proceedings where the incumbent is required to provide expert testimony and be cross-examined by counsel for those parties who oppose the incumbent's recommendations.
  • Manages stakeholder involvement in developing policies that address emerging issues such as alternative resources and distributed generation, the enhancement of infrastructure reliability and to analyze other policies that promote the public interests of Washington citizens.

What we're looking for:

To qualify for the Regulatory Analyst 1 in-training, applicants must meet the education and competency requirements. Experience is not required for this level.

Regulatory Analyst 2 - Required Education and Experience:
  • Bachelor's Degree involving major study in economics, financial accounting, business administration, or other field directly relevant to electric and gas utility regulation. In rare situations, an individual without the requisite degree may qualify by demonstrating knowledge and abilities equivalent to the degree that have been attained through a combination of work experience and education.
  • Three years of experience performing professional level research and analysis with an institution primarily engaged in regulatory matters or energy utility business operations. An advanced degree in a field directly applicable to public utility regulation will substitute for one year of the desired qualifications. Completion of the Regulatory Analyst 1 level part of the in-training program will substitute for two years of the required experience.

Position Specific Competencies:
  • Analytical Skills and Critical Thinking – Formulates judgments on complex issues through the identification, organization, and analysis of factual evidence and quantitative data; Reaches unbiased conclusions through logical reasoning and analytical objectivity; Maintains skepticism of unsupported claims and reliably identifies fallacious logic; Distinguishes information that is not pertinent to a decision or solution.
  • Professional Writing and Communication Skills – Writes clearly, concisely and coherently, using organized thought and logically reasoned arguments; Effectively translates complex technical concepts into messages others can readily grasp; Listens carefully, reflects upon what is being said, and responds appropriately; Presents information clearly, accurately and in an audience-specific manner.
  • Professional Conduct – Takes responsibility for actions; Is courteous, considerate and respectful at all times in all interactions with coworkers, utility representatives and other parties with whom we interact; Maintains cordial relations with coworkers; Exercises self-awareness, recognizing and controlling behavior that is disrespectful, aggressive, unnecessarily argumentative or overly confrontational; Sets aside personal differences to complete work as part of a team; Respects the point of view of others and approaches disagreements with patience and tact; Adheres to the UTC's Values at all times:
    • Respect: We treat every person and interaction with consideration and goodwill.
    • Professionalism: We are committed to excellence in our work and conduct.
    • Integrity: We do the right things for the right reasons- trusting others to do the same.
    • Accountability: With courage, we hold ourselves and each other accountable for exhibiting respect, professionalism, and integrity.

Agency-wide Core Competencies:
  • Customer Focus – Responsive to both internal and external customers. Works with customer to identify needs; assumes responsibility for own role in meeting those needs. Ensures commitments to customers are met. Receptive to customer feedback.
  • Results Focus – Accepts personal accountability for individual results or share of team results. Manages workload and interpersonal relationships to achieve results; prioritizes tasks appropriately, overcomes obstacles, works with others as necessary, and meets deadlines and quality standards.
  • Communication Skills – Demonstrates communication skills (reading comprehension, writing, listening, speaking) appropriate to the position. Shows respect and courtesy in interpersonal communications.
  • Adaptability/Flexibility – Open to new ideas. Responds constructively to change and stressful situations. In consultation with supervisor, adjusts plans to meet changing needs.
  • Self-Development – Demonstrates proactive learning. Keeps knowledge and skills up-to-date. Solicits and accepts constructive feedback. Seeks developmental assignments to improve skills. Turns challenges into learning opportunities.
  • Continuous Process Improvement – Uses Lean tools and principles to continuously identify improvements, solve problems, and improve work processes. Participates on process improvement projects/teams. Actively engages in section/division huddles and incorporates visual management into daily work.

Although not required, preference may be given to candidates who have the following desired qualifications:

Education and Experience:
  • Advanced degree in relevant field, such as business administration, economics, financial accounting, law, or public utility regulation;
  • Professional experience in economic analysis, financial accounting, public utility regulation, public utility law, or utility business operations;
  • Professional experience in persuasive writing or writing for decision-makers;
  • Experience analyzing technical issues in the electric or natural gas industries.

Competencies:
  • Public Speaking – Presents information and responds to questions clearly and accurately in public and in formal legal settings. Presents analytical findings and recommendations at open public meetings before the Commission. Defends analysis and recommendations against cross-examination by opposing counsel in formal adjudicative proceedings.
  • Principles of Economics – Applies economic theory to the analysis of utility operations and corporate decision-making processes; Reviews and/or performs analyses of operational cost pressures, risk management strategies, project business cases, class cost of service, and least cost resource optimization.
  • Financial Accounting – Applies accounting standards and principles (such as GAAP) to the analysis of utility financial statements, such as income statements and balance sheets. Audits utility books, reviews various accounting adjustments, ensures adherence to the matching principle, and assesses the appropriateness for rate recovery of items presented in the utility's financial results of operations.
  • Application of Regulatory Principles – Develops positions and recommendations in accordance with administrative rules, Washington statutes defining an agency's regulatory authority, policy and interpretive statements, regulatory theory, and precedent established in legal decisions.
  • Demonstrated subject matter expertise consisting of theory and/or practice of one or more of the following: production cost modeling; cost of service studies; rate design; integrated resource planning; analysis of environmental issues such as externalities or avoided costs; energy forecasting; evaluation, measurement and verification of conservation energy savings; implementation of conservation programs; energy conservation potential; infrastructure planning and design; renewable resources; electric distribution or transmission system design, operations, and reliability; energy supply and demand planning; infrastructure expansion, replacement, protection, and life extension policies and procedures; development or deployment of distributed generation or demand response technologies; or low-income assistance programs.
  • Demonstrated skills using one or more of the following: production cost modeling software; statistical software packages; geographic information systems (GIS) software or other proprietary modeling software packages.

Conditions of Employment:

This position is included in the Washington Federation of State Employees bargaining unit.

Conflict of Interest: RCW 80.01.020 limits the commission's ability to employ any person who owns stock in any company the commission regulates or is otherwise financially interested in such company.

Application Process:

This recruitment will remain open until a sufficient number of qualified candidates have applied and may be closed without notice any time after seven calendar days. The hiring managers reserve the right to make a hiring decision at any time. It is to your advantage to apply as soon as possible.

Read the instructions below carefully before following the "Apply" link above.

In addition to completing the online application and Supplemental Questionnaire, applicants must attach the following documents to their application to be considered for this position:
  • A letter of interest explaining how you meet the qualifications. If you are applying for both positions, your letter should explain how you qualify for each position;
  • A current resume detailing experience and education;
  • College transcript(s) – unofficial will suffice; and,
  • A list of three professional references with current telephone numbers, including your current or most recent supervisor (or you may include this information in the Reference section of your application). A professional reference is defined as an individual who has been paid to supervise your work and can attest to your work performance, technical skills, and job competencies. If you do not have any or sufficient professional references, please include non-related professionals, such as educators or other professional associates.

READ THE FOLLOWING INFORMATION COMPLETELY:
  • Carefully review your application and other documents requested (e.g., cover letter and resume) for accuracy, spelling and grammar before submitting.
  • The initial screening of applications will be solely based on the contents and completeness of the "work experience" and "education" sections of your application in www.careers.wa.gov; completeness of your resume, cover letter, and any other materials submitted as part of the application process; and responses to the supplemental questionnaire.
  • A resume will not substitute for completing the "work experience" section of the application.

Only complete applications will be considered. All information may be verified and documentation may be required. You may be disqualified if your education and/or work experience does not include information used to meet the minimum qualifications of the job.

Visit these links to learn more about:
the state of Washington http://access.wa.gov,
the Olympia area www.co.thurston.wa.us or
www.Olympiawa.gov

The Utilities and Transportation Commission is an equal opportunity employer. We strive to create a working environment that includes and respects cultural, racial, ethnic, sexual orientation and gender identity diversity. Women, racial, and ethnic minorities, persons with disabilities, persons over 40 years of age, disabled and Vietnam era veterans and people of all sexual orientations and gender identities are encouraged to apply. Persons needing accommodation in the application process or this announcement in an alternative format may contact Tami Knighten at (360) 664-1132 or Tami.Knighten@utc.wa.gov. For TTY service, please call the Washington Relay Service at 7-1-1 or 1-800-833-6384.

  • Reviews, analyzes and reaches conclusions on complex utility filings.
  • Evaluates the validity of utility requests through quantitative analysis and by applying principles of economics, financial accounting, and regulatory theory.
  • Provides the Commission with objective recommendations on decisions for utility filings through formal written memoranda, commissioner briefings, and public presentation.
  • Provides the Commission with objective recommendations on complex issues in a formal adjudications, such as general rate proceedings, through written expert testimony. Defends staff positions against cross examination by opposing counsel. Participates as a member of a team critically and comprehensively assessing the utility's need for additional revenues.
  • Participates in individual and team projects exploring defined investigative, administrative or policy issues, often initiated by the Commission or its regulatory staff rather than by a utility filing. Duties may include consideration of new or revised approaches to utility regulation and initiatives to improve the efficiency of Energy Regulation's business processes.
", "
  • Conducts economic evaluations of utility company filings regarding: conservation goals that conform with Washington statutes; the attainment of previously determined conservation targets; the prudence of investments in generation and distribution facilities; the portfolio of energy resources to meet future service needs; complex pricing proposals designed to promote conservation; the introduction of new services; and plans to support low income customers.
  • Uses economic analysis to create recommendations to senior management and commissioners. Develops written testimony that is filed in highly contentious legal proceedings where the incumbent is required to provide expert testimony and be cross-examined by counsel for those parties who oppose the incumbent's recommendations.
  • Manages stakeholder involvement in developing policies that address emerging issues such as alternative resources and distributed generation, the enhancement of infrastructure reliability and to analyze other policies that promote the public interests of Washington citizens.
", '
  • A letter of interest explaining how you meet the qualifications. If you are applying for both positions, your letter should explain how you qualify for each position;
  • A current resume detailing experience and education;
  • College transcript(s) – unofficial will suffice; and,
  • A list of three professional references with current telephone numbers, including your current or most recent supervisor (or you may include this information in the Reference section of your application). A professional reference is defined as an individual who has been paid to supervise your work and can attest to your work performance, technical skills, and job competencies. If you do not have any or sufficient professional references, please include non-related professionals, such as educators or other professional associates.
']

ShortDescription: HAVE YOU HEARD THE DIRTT? You don’t settle for ordinary. You have a strong go-getter attitude. You’re extremely detail oriented and not afraid to get things…
FullDescription:
HAVE YOU HEARD THE DIRTT?

You don’t settle for ordinary. Neither do we. Pull that superhero cape out of your closet. Join a community of passionate and energetic people on a mission to change how the world builds. It's not always going to be easy. That's why we’re focused on performance, favoring talent over seniority, degrees and titles.

You have a strong go-getter attitude. You’re extremely detail oriented and not afraid to get things done. You’re a driven, energetic, and professional individual with a strong work ethic.

At DIRTT, we believe that in order to do better, we need to build better. We don’t have offices or titles, and our employees are known affectionately as DIRTTbags. Our entrepreneurial spirit and core values are redefining the construction industry. We celebrate our success together and achieve what others can only dream about. Do you have what it takes?

The Successful Candidate

Creativity and persistence are crucial in this exciting and demanding Sales Representative (DIRTT Rep) position. As the successful candidate, you’re resourceful, professional along with a strong and positive go-getter attitude. You always see the big picture and implement suitable strategies to ensure success. You thrive in autonomous environments and are driven to meet and surpass goals.


More specifically:

  • You have a demonstrable track record of success in the commercial interior construction industry, are conversant with architectural drawings, details and specifications with a strong understanding of the construction process, real estate market and job site conditions. Your solid understanding of the construction industry, job site conditions and building processes allow you to relate to general contractors and project managers. In essence, you speak their language.
  • Your sharp business acumen is evident throughout your daily interactions, whether in a formal business meeting with potential partners or on site with builders.
  • You possess strong communication, negotiation and interpersonal skills, enabling you to engage in open dialogue and build rapport with Partners and clients from facilities managers to the C-Suite.
  • You have excellent presentation skills and are comfortable using technology for presentation and communication purposes.
  • You are able to create and maintain relationships with our end-users, identifying with clients’ priorities and goals.
  • You have extraordinary listening skills with attention to detail, and follow-through to ensure complete client satisfaction to the final installation of their project.
  • You are a strong team player, collaborating effectively and able to trouble-shoot to the successful completion of a project.


Responsibilities:

You are a wealth of information on all things DIRTT. Clients and project stakeholders see you as their main resource for guidance on DIRTT’s solutions, processes and software. As a key member of DIRTT’s sales team, your main focus is to attract and retain new and existing business relationships with partners, clients, sales reps and other stakeholders. You are also directly responsible for the success of your local DIRTT sales partners and accordingly, must also function as their local mentor and wingman.


Partner Connections:

  • Be the first point of contact for all things DIRTT, supporting everyone on your local DIRTT partner’s team throughout the sales process, while also functioning as the face of DIRTT within their organization as a whole.
  • Work with the local DIRTT Partner, integrating with their team and harnessing each other’s talents to grow the overall DIRTT business in the market, and building productive relationships.
  • Work with DIRTT resources (Product Development, Project Management, the Power and Network teams, and Info, etc.) to provide answers and troubleshoot issues in the field.
  • Prioritize opportunities and execute on DIRTT’s go-to-market plans to identify and qualify leads to ensure the best use of time by our partners and DIRTT.
  • Coordinate DIRTT training for all members of Partner team; arrange vertical market specialists and technician visits.
  • Meet personal and Partner team sales targets.


Client/BD Services:

  • Your primary motivation is to satisfy our clients first and foremost to ensure an excellent experience to them. Learn and appreciate the needs of clients, from the C-suite to facilities and IT teams, forming relationships and building trust.
  • Create plans for new sales channels and opportunities.
  • Introduce new offerings to existing markets and clients in creative ways that highlight the value proposition.
  • Identify and assess the value of business opportunities (clients and partnerships) and create strategies to drive long-term growth.
  • Address deficiencies in the field – warranty issues, Partner deficiencies. Work with Corporate to address factory issues/warranties; meet with clients to retain relationship.
  • Maintain client relationships and support client needs post-installation.
  • Create visibility and expand your network with community involvement, industry associations (BOMA/IFMA/etc.), leads groups and networking events. Create events to attract end users and construction industry influencers; create and nurture those relationships.
  • Create and give presentations for all vertical market groups and A&D and GC’s.
  • Engage in open dialogue with construction industry stakeholders and thought leaders.


As a DIRTTBag:

  • Have a thorough understanding of DIRTT’s proprietary software platform, ICE, DIRTT offerings, and processes to work with clients on bringing projects to life.
  • Stay well-informed on the happenings of DIRTT, our sales tools and technologies by attending meetings, sales events and trainings to keep abreast of the latest developments.
  • Accurately forecast sales, develop sales strategies, and report and provide feedback to management.
  • Share sales strategies with other reps and participate in team-building exercises and sharing of information.
  • Work with other Reps on intermarket sales insuring a successful project and client experience.
  • Provide feedback on Partner operational effectiveness in the market.

This position reports to the Regional Sales Director.

Our package offer includes a base salary, excellent benefits and commission.


To apply for this position, email us at careers@dirtt.net. Please include the position title in your subject line. No direct phone calls or in-person visits please.
GenBulletPoints:
['
  • Be the first point of contact for all things DIRTT, supporting everyone on your local DIRTT partner’s team throughout the sales process, while also functioning as the face of DIRTT within their organization as a whole.
  • Work with the local DIRTT Partner, integrating with their team and harnessing each other’s talents to grow the overall DIRTT business in the market, and building productive relationships.
  • Work with DIRTT resources (Product Development, Project Management, the Power and Network teams, and Info, etc.) to provide answers and troubleshoot issues in the field.
  • Prioritize opportunities and execute on DIRTT’s go-to-market plans to identify and qualify leads to ensure the best use of time by our partners and DIRTT.
  • Coordinate DIRTT training for all members of Partner team; arrange vertical market specialists and technician visits.
  • Meet personal and Partner team sales targets.
']

ShortDescription: I need a tutor with expertise for a school project. Specifically, I need help with creating wireframes, storyboards, and GUI. Would like lessons to begin:
FullDescription:
I need a tutor with expertise for a school project. Specifically, I need help with creating wireframes, storyboards, and GUI. The project has simple requirements, however, I do not know anything about HTML, CSS, JavaScript, or Visual Basic. The assignment requires me to use one of those listed (not all). I just need to turn in the screenshots.

Student/Parent Information:
Location: Kent, WA 98031
Subject: Web Design
Student grade level: College

Lesson Information:
Would like lessons to begin: Today
Availability: I'm flexible
Preferred lesson location: Library / public place

Web Design Tutoring & Teaching opportunities available in Kent, WA starting at $25-$50/hr.

  • Apply to become a tutor listed on Wyzant to help this student and other students in your community
  • Work with a variety of students in your best subjects
  • Spend more time teaching and less time administering
  • Set your own hours while you help students learn the subjects you love to teach
Qualifications
  • A love of learning
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Expertise in a variety of disciplines
  • Passion for helping others learn and succeed
Pay
  • Set your own rate (most tutors charge between $30-60/hour)
  • Commission fee is only 20-40% compared to the 60-80% that traditional tutoring companies take.
Application Process
  • Upon submission, your application will be reviewed to ensure quality before becoming active.
  • You'll receive an initial response within 48 hours of submission.

RoleTitle: Designer Handbags Sales Associate(Multilingual Preferred) - Draw Vs Commission
ShortDescription: To be the premier omni-channel retailer of luxury and fashion merchandise dedicated to providing superior service and a distinctive shopping experience in our…
FullDescription:
COMPANY OVERVIEW
For over a century, Neiman Marcus Group has served the unique needs of our discerning customers by staying true to the principles of our founders: to be the premier omni-channel retailer of luxury and fashion merchandise dedicated to providing superior service and a distinctive shopping experience in our stores and on our websites. Neiman Marcus Group is comprised of the Specialty Retail Stores division, which includes Neiman Marcus and Bergdorf Goodman, and our international brand, mytheresa.com. Our portfolio of brands offers the finest luxury and fashion apparel, accessories, jewelry, beauty, and home décor. The Company operates more than 40 Neiman Marcus full-line stores in the most affluent markets across the United States, including U.S. gateway cities that draw an international clientele. In addition, we operate 2 Bergdorf Goodman stores in landmark locations on Fifth Avenue in New York City. We also operate more than 40 Last Call by Neiman Marcus off-price stores that cater to a value oriented, yet fashion minded customer. Our upscale eCommerce and direct-to-consumer division includes NeimanMarcus.com, BergdorfGoodman.com Horchow.com, LastCall.com, and CUSP.com. Every day each of our 15,000 NMG associates works towards the goal of enabling our customer to shop any of our brands "anytime, anywhere, and on any device." Whether the merchandise we sell, the customer service we offer, or our investments in technology, everything we do is to enhance the customer experience across all channels and brands.
Qualifications

DESCRIPTION


  • Creates a welcoming environment by greeting and approaching customers
  • Exceeds customer expectations by providing assistance with a positive attitude
  • Recommends merchandise based on product knowledge and customer preferences
  • Is knowledgeable and educates self and others on merchandise
  • Demonstrates timely follow-up and follow-through on customer requests and commitments
  • Actively creates a welcoming environment through teamwork and collaboration
  • Effectively utilizes mobile devices to communicate with customers and expand business
  • Effectively utilizes available clientele tools and resources to increase personal business
  • Frequently advises customers of the benefits of the InCircle program
  • Works to develop long term customer relationships
  • Assist in maintaining visual and merchandise presentation standards on the selling floor
  • Ensure audit compliance
  • Demonstrate flexibility and ability to adapt to the changing needs of the business

QUALIFICATIONS


  • Excellent customer service skills
  • Motivated and results driven
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Ability to work autonomously
  • Commission sales experience preferred
  • Previous retail experience preferred

  • Standing, bending, lifting, climbing stairs

  • Associates must be willing to work a flexible schedule based on business need, which will include evenings, weekends and holidays.
Primary Location: United States of America-Washington-KING-Bellevue-Bellevue Store
Work Locations: Bellevue Store Neiman Marcus 11111 NE 8th Street Bellevue 98004
Job: Retail Store Sales
Organization: Neiman Marcus
Schedule: Full-time
Shift: Flexible
Employee Status: Regular
Job Type: Standard
Job Level: Individual Contributor
Travel: No
Job Posting: Jun 20, 2019, 10:17:10 PM

RoleTitle: Business Development Manager Software Development and Services
ShortDescription: The New Business Development Manager will be responsible for the full life-cycle sales process of short and long-term initiatives for Software development and…
FullDescription:
Job Description

The New Business Development Manager will be responsible for the full life-cycle sales process of short and long-term initiatives for Software development and Services including IT staffing requirements by identifying and securing new business opportunities.

Roles and Responsibilities

· Develop account penetration strategy, gain account intelligence and develop business with new clients

· Generate sales leads and set client meetings to develop new accounts, establish relationships at multiple levels throughout the client organization, and close viable business opportunities

· Manage the client relationship, recognize key client issues, and ensure that client needs and project objectives are consistently met through weekly/monthly follow-up.

· One of the primary points of contact for an assigned account

· Achieve business targets for assigned client account(s)

· Work closely with recruiting to insure delivery of staffing requirements

· Become thoroughly familiar with client systems and processes for submitting resumes

· Communicate and prioritize client requirements to sales executives and recruiters

· Negotiate bill rates with client managers, if applicable

· Conduct client meetings to build and maintain relationships

· Develop individual leads, including leads for new accounts

· Submit weekly, monthly and other related sales reports

· Responsible for building a sales pipeline for prospects

· Effectively manage and prioritize a high volume of requisitions

· Interact closely with the technical recruiting team to clearly communicate client requirements ensuring the successful identification of candidates

· Negotiate contracts and close agreements to maximize profits

Education and Experience

· Experience selling IT Solutions, Staff Augmentation. Experience with IT Staffing firm a major plus

· Track record of achieving monthly, quarterly and annual KPI targets

· Responsibilities for negotiating terms and conditions with clients

· Proven analysis, problem solving and troubleshooting expertise

· Ability to multi-task and perform effectively under pressure

· Comfortable interacting with all levels of management and roles within the client organization

· Ability to effectively prioritize and escalate customer issues as required

· Detailed, organized, and result oriented

· MS Office (particularly MS Excel) expertise required.

· Demonstrated proficiency in the full sales life cycle, including client prospecting and proposal development, as well as negotiating and closing

· Proven work experience as an Account Manager, Sales Account Manager, Junior Account Manager or relevant role

· Ability to communicate, present and influence key stakeholders at all levels of an organization, including executive and C-level

· Excellent listening, negotiation and presentation abilities

· Strong verbal and written communication skills

· BA/BS degree in Business Administration, Sales or relevant field

This is a Commission based employment. Depending on your performance and company growth we consider to offer a full time opportunity.

Job Types: Contract, Commission

Job Types: Part-time, Temporary, Internship, Contract, Commission

Experience:

  • Sales: 1 year (Preferred)
  • Business development: 1 year (Required)

Location:

  • Redmond, WA 98052 (Preferred)

Work authorization:

  • United States (Preferred)

Contract Renewal:

  • Likely

RoleTitle: Sales Representative - Web Design - Commission Based
ShortDescription: We are looking for people experienced in sales who are looking for some extra side income. We are a web development / mobile application development company and…
FullDescription:
We are looking for people experienced in sales who are looking for some extra side income. We are a web development / mobile application development company and are hiring commission based sales staff. Pay is 20% of the sale goes to you, after 10 sales, that goes up to 25%. Sales average from 1500$ to 20,000$ or more depending on what the client needs. On-top of that, if the customer hosts with us, or gets a monthly management package, 20% of that goes to you as well every time they pay, so you can make passive income over time. We currently have one sales person who is earning 4,000$ + a month in commission sales, and he has peaked over $10,000 a month before. We are looking to expand to a few more sales reps. Must have experience in sales, have a decent understanding of how web design / mobile applications can help a business. This is a great opportunity for someone who can sell! Please provide your resume, along with a brief description on why you feel you would be a good fit for this position. Thank you!

Job Type: Commission

Salary: $4,000.00 /month

ShortDescription: Protect & grow local business market share through Local Business Automation and use of our customizable software. Build a pipeline of prospects & close deals.
FullDescription:
Outside Software Sales

Are you just working for a company or are you part of a CAUSE?

Our Cause: Protect & grow local business market share through Local Business Automation and use of our customizable software

Local Business Automation - Customizable Software

We provide a unique way to automate business's everyday operations with software. Our software offers Customer Relationship Management (CRM), Search Engine Optimization, Marketing, online invoices & receipts, text messaging, email marketing and social media management. This automation provides the edge a local business needs to better succeed in their market. We do it all in a convenient app which allows the business owner complete control over their operations anytime, anywhere, and all from the palm of their hand. http://www.dexmedia.com/solutions/dexhub


Who you are:

We are seeking hungry and moldable individuals to strategize and offer our unique software solutions to local business owners. In addition, the candidate selected to join our team will be upselling existing accounts as well as growing local business via cutting edge leads generation platforms. We are looking for individuals who are:

  • Goal oriented...you're known for destroying your sales goals
  • Persuasive...you can explain software solutions in simple terms
  • Exceed sales quotas & expectations
  • Build a pipeline of prospects & close deals
  • Develop great solutions to help customers WIN!

Basic Qualifications

  • +2 years sales
  • Proven record of prospecting & cold calling experience
  • Tech Savvy
  • Valid driver's license and clear driving record required, no multiple infractions within last 12 months

Preferred Qualifications

  • Proven success in new business acquisition
  • Experience in up-selling Software Solutions
  • Desire to achieve and be competitive with an optimistic attitude

About Dex YP

Dex YP is the leading provider of marketing solutions for local businesses. We partner with local businesses across the U.S. to help them get found, get chosen, and get talked about. We're passionate about helping our clients create and grow their customer relationships by providing comprehensive marketing solutions that include websites, print, mobile, social media, and search engine marketing solutions. We are trusted by more than 480,000 local businesses nationwide, which look to us to help them achieve their marketing goals.

As a member of the Dex Media team, you will enjoy INCREDIBLE benefits in a REALLY FANTASTIC culture. This is a full-time position that offers a salary and UN-CAPPED commissions. If you are confident in your ability to hunt & sell...you WILL make great money and have fun doing it.

Dex YP Benefits:

  • Medical (includes Rx and Vision)
  • Dental
  • Life and AD&D insurance
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Flexible spending and health savings accounts
  • Short and Long-term disability benefits
  • Tuition Assistance
  • 401k - Company match
  • Paid time off programs
  • Mileage or transportation reimbursement for applicable positions

Visit our website: http://www.dexmedia.com/


Dex YP is an equal opportunity employer

ShortDescription: Our Business Development Center is responsible for answering all incoming sales inquiries via phone, email, text, and chat. Must have strong work ethic.
FullDescription:
If you’re searching for a career with innovative, collaborative, fast-paced company, look no further - South Tacoma Auto is the perfect place for you to call home.

South Tacoma Auto is changing the perception of the used car industry for both our customers and our employees. We aspire to develop a relationship in which both the company and our employees contribute to each other's growth.

Our Business Development Center is responsible for answering all incoming sales inquiries via phone, email, text, and chat. Within the BDC, our Business Development Representatives play a vital role in our customer relations. As one of our reps, you would respond to customer inquiries and ultimately schedule appointments for them. You would be responsible for documenting customer interactions in a CRM software as well as accurately recording detailed data in an Excel/Google Spreadsheet. You would work closely with team members from other departments to assist our customers.

Our goal is to build good business relationships with integrity, transparency, and passion for our customers and co-workers.

No previous experience in the auto industry is required, however an appetite for knowledge and learning is key.

Qualifications needed:

  • Education - High School diploma or GED; some college is preferred
  • Valid Driver's License
  • Must have excellent written and verbal communication, collaboration, analytical and problem solving skills
  • Must have previous phone experience (2+ years preferred)
  • Must be punctual
  • Must have strong work ethic

Our ideal candidate is an ambitious, performance-driven, self-starter. We are looking for someone who operates with honesty, well-roundedness, work-life balance, and good communication. We need someone to contribute professionalism, dedication, and passion to make our strong team even stronger.

Company Benefits include: bonuses, paid time off, tuition reimbursement program, employee assistance program, and other voluntary benefits such as Dental and Voluntary Life insurance. Fun work environment with interesting people. Abundant opportunities for personal development are offered. Extensive training offered.


Job Type: Full-time


Compensation: $35,000.00 to $45,000.00 /year depending on performance


The position pays off of performance. Compensation is a combination of commission earned by performance on top hourly pay. The average earnings for our current reps is between $35,000 and $45,000.

Please apply by clicking "Apply for this job." We will need your resume, three references, and a cover letter. We look forward to meeting you!

  • Valid Driver's License

  • Must have previous phone experience (2+ years preferred)
  • Must be punctual
  • Must have strong work ethic
"]
